text: Hi! I’m struggling with HubSpot CMS CLI – we’ve been uploading some static pages to a path `portals/123098-xxxx/content/files/homepage-new` but now it seems like i cannot access that directory anymore – CMS CLI allows me only to preview files of the HubSpot page and modules :cry: Is there any way to check the folders structure in CMS CLI (except fetching `/` ). How can i access the `portals/123098-xxxx/content/files/homepage-new`  directory? From my perspective CMS CLI gives me access to `123098-xxxx` but when i’m trying to fetch `content` for example it throws an error that it doesn’t exist :disappointed:
Hey Adam, to confirm, the path you noted is the path you used to upload/fetch from using FTP?

For the CMS CLI, the path you should use is the exact path the file/directory lives in. So if you are fetching a Design Manager folder my/folder you would fetch `hs fetch my/folder --portal=1234`, and upload `hs upload my/folder my/folder --portal=1234`

Similar for the file manager - you use the path as it lives within the File Manager. But do note fetch is not yet supported with the File Manager using the CLI, although it should be available soon. We just finished the initial implementation, but ti is not yet released <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/pull/215>

Hi! I’m working on a vue instance and the sale team want i integrate a HubSpot form and Cta’s, for the CTA it’s working, but for the form i lost :sob: Someone can help me ? (i’m not dev just designer with basics)
Hi, has anyone ever managed to render HubSpot landing pages with personalisation working by simply copy/pasting HTML/CSS/JS from the static landing pages to it’s own file on another domain?
